meanings.definition: A foreigner living in ancient Greece who was not a citizen.
meanings.sent1: The metic in the village always shared stories of their homeland.
meanings.sent2: The historian studied the life of a metic in ancient Greece.
meanings.sent3: The metic tried to blend in by wearing a toga and sandals.
meanings.sent4: The metic's presence in the marketplace added a touch of exoticism.
meanings.sent5: The metic's accent was a melodic reminder of distant lands.

meanings.definition: A person who is meticulous or careful in their work.
meanings.sent1: The metic double-checked every detail of the project before presenting it.
meanings.sent2: The metic's reputation for precision made them a sought-after craftsman.
meanings.sent3: The metic's desk was always organized with color-coded folders.
meanings.sent4: Her eye for detail was so sharp, she was known as the metic of the office.
meanings.sent5: The metic's careful brushstrokes brought the painting to life.
